doc.title: Mutable

value.content: A mutable value is one that can be changed without creating an entirely new value. In JavaScript, objects and arrays are mutable by default, but primitive values are not — once a primitive value is created, it cannot be changed, although the variable that holds it may be reassigned.

value.title: See also
value.content:
• Immutable object on Wikipedia
  • Immutable
